Berta is divorced and has a school-aged child.  She lives in her own house in the Cosmos 79 area in the city of El Alto.  She received only a primary education and works as a cleaning lady at a private company that makes sodas.

The loan she is requesting is to buy construction materials (paint, tiles, calamine) to repair leaks the house has sustained during the rainy season.  

Berta's goals is to leave her son a well-built house in perfect condition.  This is her first loan through IMPRO and KIVA.

loans.use: To buy construction material to repair her home.

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.es:
Gregorio es casado, tiene cinco hijos de los cuales cuatro estan en etapa escolar, vive en casa propia  ubicada en la zona de Villa San Felipe de Seke de la ciudad de El Alto.
Gregorio solo pudo terminar la primaria. El trabaja como maestro albañil en distintas obras de construccion de la urbe alteña.
Necesita credito para adquirir una computadora e impresora ya que su hija estudia la carrera de enfermeria  en la localidad de Pucarani, de esa manera el padre le ayuda a la hija a realizar sus trabajos universitarios.
El sueño de Gregorio es que todos sus hijos sean profesionales con titulo universitario.
Es la tercera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Gregorio is married and has five school-aged children.  He lives in his own house in the Villa San Felipe de Seke area in the city of El Alto.

Gregorio was only able to get a primary education and works as a bricklayer at different construction sites in the urban area of the city.  He is in need of a loan to buy a computer and printer for his daughter who is studying nursing in Pucarani.  This is how he can help with her university studies.

Gregorio's goal is for all of his children to become professionals with university degrees.  This is his third loan through IMPRO and first from KIVA.

loans.use: To buy a computer and printer for his daughter.

loans.name: Diana Lucia

texts.es: La Sra. Diana tiene 20 años,  ella se dedica a la confección de ropa deportiva, ella se dedica a esta actividad hace ya 3 años, su taller se encuentran ubicado en la zona Radio Cruz de la ciudad  la ciudad de La Paz, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, La Sra. Diana utilizara este préstamo para compra de maquina recta y tela  para la confección de sus prendas de vestir, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es falta de capital de trabajo, La Sra. Diana enfrenta retos en su negocio que son seguir mejorando la calidad de la confección de las prendas de vestir y  va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir aumentando  su  capital de trabajo su deseo para su negocio es crecer y confeccionar variedad de prendas de vestir y tener una tienda donde exhibir sus productos ya que ahora solo entrega a distintas ferias y mercados de la ciudad y a pedido para distintas instituciones educativas y entidades.
texts.en: Diana is twenty years old. She has been making sports clothes for three years in her workshop, located in the Radio Cruz neighbourhood of La Paz. This loan is her first with the field partner. She will use the funds to buy a sewing machine and cloth to make clothes. She needs the loan because she lacks working capital. Diana set a challenge for helsef: to keep improving the quality of her production. She plans to use the profits to increase her working capital. Diana wishes for her business to grow and her aim is to make more clothes in different styles, in order, ultimately, to have a shop where she would sell her products, since, for the time being, she has to make do with supplying various open-air markets in her city and fulfilling orders for several schools and organisations.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and cloth.

loans.name: Sonia Siumara

texts.es: Sonia, tiene 29 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposa, con quien tiene tres hijos, residen en una aldea del municipio de Santa Cruz de Yojoa. Hace 5 años estableció una pulpería, donde vende productos alimenticios como granos básicos, refrescos, churros, galletas, carnes, lácteos, manteca, azucar, achineria como cremas, rasuradoras, desodorantes, lapices, etc. este negocio es su fuente de ingresos familiares. Ha solicitado un segundo préstamo a ODEF por 10,000 Lempiras para comprar carnes, arroz y azúcar para surtir la pulpería. Su sueño es seguir con el negocio para mejorar las condiciones de vida en su familia.
texts.en:
Sonia, 29, lives with her common-law husband and their three children in a village that belongs to the Santa Cruz de Yojoa municipality.  Five years ago she opened a grocery store where she sells basic grains, soft drinks, doughnuts, cookies, meats, dairy products, shortening, sugar, creams, shaving supplies, deodorants, pencils, etc.  The business is the family's source of income.

She has requested a loan for 10,000 HNL through ODEF to buy meats, rice and sugar to stock the store.  Her goal is to continue with her business in order to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy meats, rice and sugar for her store.

loans.name: Nicanor

texts.es:
Nicanor de 58 años de edad, está casado con Natividad y tiene 9 hijos, de los cuales solo vive con 4 de ellos; en la casa rústica que construyó hace algunos años. Desde muy joven se dedico al negocio de sus padres, “la agricultura”, tiene 30 años de experiencia en el rubro. En todo este tiempo logró obtener sus propios terrenos agrícolas, en donde siembra papa, alverja, oyuco, zanahoria y flor de gladiolo; los que después de mucho esfuerzo, dedicación y trabajo, los comercializa en el mercado mayorista de su ciudad, pero en campaña agrícola, los comercializa en otras ciudades, en donde obtiene mayores ganancias. Pero como buen hombre del campo, Nicanor también se dedica a la ganadería, donde gracias a sus 8 vacas, todas las mañanas saca leche y hace queso. Vendiéndolo a los comerciantes minoristas que visitan la zona; además de cuidar y vacunar a sus animales constantemente. Él está feliz de vivir en el campo por ello está trabajando para mejorar sus cultivos y así obtener mayor rentabilidad. Este es su quinto crédito con KIVA y se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Nicanor, invertirá los S/.2000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Nicanor, 58, is married to Natividad and they have nine children, only four of whom live at home in the rustic house they built years ago.  Since he was young, Nicanor has worked in his parent's agriculture business so he has 30 years' experience in the sector.  Over time he has been able to buy his own farmland where he grows potatoes, peas, olluco (root vegetable) and gladiolus flowers.  After much effort, dedication and work he sells his produce at the city wholesale market and in other cities where he can earn more.

But like any good farmer, Nicanor also raises livestock and milks his eight cows every morning so he can make cheese.   He sells it to retailers who visit the area.  He also cares for and vaccinates his animals constantly.  He is happy to live in the country and is working to improve his crops to earn more profit.  

This is his fifth KIVA loan and he is grateful for the financial support he receives in advance and committed to paying back the loan on time.  Nicanor will use the 2,000 PEN to buy organic fertilizer for his crops.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Evelin

texts.es:
Evelin es soltera,  no tiene  hijos, vive en una casa bajo la modalidad de anticretico a nombre de sus padres, el domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Villa Ciudad Satelite de la ciudad de El Alto.
Evelin termino la secundaria, ahora estudia Contaduria Publica, cursa el primer año. Se dedica a la elaboracion de mantas las mismas las teje manualmente.
El crédito es para comprar una maquina tejedora asi podra aumentar la cantidad de produccion.
El sueño de Evelin es tener su taller de tejidos y culminar sus estudios superiores.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Evelin is single and has no children.  She lives in a home her parents have leased in the area of Villa Ciudad Satelite in the city of El Alto.

Evelin finished her secondary education and is now in her first year of public accounting.  She knits blankets by hand and the loan she is requesting is to buy a knitting machine to increase her production.

Evelin's goal is to finish her higher education and establish her own knitting workshop.  This is her first loan through IMPRO and KIVA.

loans.use: To buy a knitting machine for her blanket business.

loans.name: Oscar Luis

texts.es: El Joven Oscar sigue con la misma actividad se dedica al tapizado de asientos y muebles, cuenta que le fue bien con el anterior crédito ya que lo utilizo en la compra de cuero y cuerina por mayor, en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de cuero y materiales para el tapizado de asientos de automóviles ya que tiene mucho trabajo y necesita este materia imprescindible para realizar su trabajo,  se siente feliz y agradecido por la oportunidad que le brindan ya que está creciendo y mejorando su actividad.
texts.en: Young Oscar continues in his seat and furniture upholstery business.  He says he used the previous loan to buy leather and faux leather wholesale.  On this occasion, he will buy leather and automobile seat upholstering materials since this is what gives him the most work.  The material is fundamental for his job.  He is grateful for the opportunity he is receiving because it allows him to grow and improve his business.

loans.use: To buy leather and seat upholstery materials.

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.es: Anastacia, de 44 años, está casada con Paulino y tiene 6 hijos, pero solo vive con 2 de ellos en su casa propia. Anastacia se dedica a varias actividades económicas. Hace 22 años que comenzó con la agricultura, sembrando alverja y papa en todas sus variedades. Según cuenta tiene diferentes terrenos agrícolas que se sitúan en los caseríos de su localidad. A mediados de año, que es cosecha grande, ella se dirige a la capital donde vende los alimentos que produce a un mayor precio. Además de dedicarse a la ganadería, donde ara la tierra con la ayuda de sus 2 toros y vende la leche que produce las 2 vacas que posee. Toda esta actividad los realiza con el apoyo de su esposo, ya que hace poco incursionó en el negocio de productos comestibles , por está razón cuenta con una tienda, donde vende productos como leche, azúcar, arroz, conservas de atun, entre otros. Por lo que desea ahorrar lo necesario para adquirir una movilidad y poder trasladarse con mayor facilidad. Éste sería su quinto crédito con KIVA y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Anastacia, desea adquirir productos comestibles tales como arroz, azúcar, leche , entre otros, para sus clientes,
texts.en:
Anastacia, 44, is married to Paulino and they have six children, only two of which still live in the family owned home.  Anastacia is involved in different businesses and 22 year ago she got involved in agriculture, growing peas and all varieties of potatoes.  She say she has different farmlands throughout the rural community of her town.  At mid year, which is when the large harvest takes place, she goes to the capital city to sell her produce at the best price. She also raises livestock and ploughs the land with the help of two oxen.  She also sells the milk her dairy cows produce.  

Her husband helps with the agricultural activity since she opened a grocery store not too long ago.  She sells products such as milk, sugar, rice, tuna, etc.  She wants to save enough money to buy a vehicle for easier transportation.  

This is her fifth KIVA loan and she is grateful for the financial support and committed to paying the loan back on time.  Anastacia wants to buy groceries such as rice, sugar, milk, etc. for her customers.

loans.use: To buy groceries such as rice, sugar, milk, etc

loans.name: Aminta Yaneth

texts.es: Aminta, tiene 46 años de edad, es madre soltera y vive con su hija en el municipio de Villanueva, Cortes.  Ella estableció su propio negocio hace 3 años de venta de ropa usada y nueva para damas caballeros y niños. Anteriormente trabajaba en una guardería y por necesidad de obtener mayores ingresos, decidió por su negocio. Ha solicitado un tercer préstamo para comprar ropa y surtir el negocio. Su objetivo es hacer crecer el negocio para poder ayudar a su hija con los estudios.
texts.en:
Aminta, 46, is a single mother and lives with her daughter in the municipality of Villanueva, Cortes.  She established her own business three years ago selling women's, men's and children's new and used clothing.  Previously she worked for a day care center but needed to earn more money and decided to go into business.

She is requesting her third loan to buy clothing to stock her business.  Her goal is to increase sales so she can help her daughter with her education.

loans.use: To buy clothing to increase her stock and sales.

loans.name: Kibibi

texts.en:
Kibibi aged 21 years, is a married woman with one kid who attends school. She owns a house that neither has electricity not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Kibibi operates a stall selling groceries and vegetables. Sher stall is in the market and she sells to town-dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding her business in the future. 

With the KES 10,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale.

loans.name: Rubabu

texts.en:
Rubabu is a widowed woman aged 50 years and with six kids. One of the kids still attends school which is the reason for her hard work. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past twenty years, Rubabu has been cooking food and selling it from home to passersby and neighbors. She cited seasonality and theft as her challenges. 

With the KES 10,000 she wants to purchase two bundles of wheat flour and cooking oil. Her dream is to expand her business and earn more income in the future.

loans.use: to purchase two bundles of wheat flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Mwanalima

texts.en:
Mwanalima is 35 years old and married. She has been blessed with two children who attend school. She lives in her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

Mwanalima owns a fish-selling business, which has been operational for more than one year. She says seasonality is one of her greatest business challenges. Mwanalima dreams of becoming a wholesaler of fish in the future. 

With the KES 50,000, she wants to purchase sacks of fish for resale. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fish for resale.

loans.name: Tea

texts.en:
Tea is 25 years old. She lives in the small village of Chiatura District with her husband, two children and her mother-in-law, who is provided with a retirement pension. Tea requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected all the time, because of her low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of income for the family is from agricultural activities. In particular, they have three milking cows, whose milk is used in dairy products. They sell the products they produce on the local markets. Besides, they have 0.5 hectare agricultural land, where different kinds of vegetables are grown. It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Tea requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Tea has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-start-up credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With the received credit Tea will begin trading dishes and household goods. This will increase the income of their family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to begin trading dishes and household goods.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is 25 years old. She is married and lives in the Terjola District with her husband, two children and retired grandmother. The family runs an agricultural business. In particular, they own four cows, two of them are milking. Salome produces cheese and sells it in the local market. In addition, the family has a pig and sells piglets seasonally.  

Since their income is not enough for the family's needs, Salome decided to start up a new business. She went to a local credit agency to get money for this business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was always rejected because of her low income and lack of experience in starting a new business. She received the loan in the framework of a start-up loan program that was initiated jointly by Credo and Kiva. This program aims at the provision of business start-up funds for the Georgian rural poor, who do not have access to regular credit products, as they live in poverty and are regarded as “borrowers with a high risk." 

With the requested credit, Salome will purchase chickens and raise them. After 4-5 months, she will start to sell them. The hens will be sold on the local open market by Salome. She will reinvest the profit for the further expansion of the farm. Also, part of the profit will be used to purchase some necessary household goods to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To start up a poultry farm.

loans.name: Ahyabala

texts.en:
Ahyabala is 49 years old and married with two children. Ahyabala lives in the Baku region with his family. His wife stays at home, so he is the only one earning an income. His son goes to school and is 15 years old. His daughter goes to a university and is 18 years old. Ahyabala wants his son to become a firefighter. 

Ahyabala started his business seven years ago to repair cars. Now he needs a loan of 2,000 AZN to repair his workplace. He wants to use the profits he earns for the future of his child. 

In the future, Ahyabala wants to have a second business location and an employee. This will enable his business to be more profitable. This is Ahyabala's first loan. He is thankful to Komak and Kiva for supporting him.

loans.use: to repair his workplace.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is a 45 year old married woman.  She has 4 children ranging in age from 8 years to 22 years.  She describes herself to be ambitious. 

She operates a food production place where she sells chappati, mandazi and chips.  She has been involved in this business for 12 years and employs 1 staff member.  Her business is located in a market area.  She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate finances to build a cafeteria.  She will use the KES 50,000 loan to add stocks of flour, cooking fat and a structure for her cafeteria.  She hopes to open a restaurant in the future.  This is her 1st application for a loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to add stock of flour, cooking fat and a structure for her cafeteria.

loans.name: Mariamu

texts.en:
Mariamu aged 61 years, is a widowed woman with nine children, all of whom are adults.  She owns a house that has electricity and piped water.  Her greatest monthly expenses are food for the family. 

For the past ten years, she has operated a charcoal selling business.  She sells from her home to her neighbors and passersby.  She faces a major challenge of a high cost of transportation.  She dreams of expanding her business to be a wholesale supplier of firewood in the village. 

With the KSHS 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase bundles of charcoal for resale.  She decided to join to Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Banco Comunal La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal la Esperanza, está conformado por 12 integrantes, madres soteras con 20 hijos bajo su responsabilidad, ellas son originarias del Sauce lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del País. Ellas se caracterizan por  trabajadoras, responsables, con ganas de superación personal. En sus ratos libres le gusta disfrutar de las compañías de sus hijos. Lamentablemente no pudieron estudiar por falta de recursos económicos, y se vieron obligadas a trabajar desde temprana edad. Ellas luchan día a día para brindarles  a sus hijos un futuro mejor.

Norma Lina es la coordinadora del Banco comunal y tiene por actividad económica compra y venta de cerdos en pie.  El objetivo del crédito es comprar un lote de cerdos en pie, que se lo están vendiendo a buen precio.  Y en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. El dedica a su negocio unas 10 horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos. El banco comunal La Esperanza agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a  los  pequeños comerciantes de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The "La Esperenza" communal bank is made up of twelve members - all single mothers and with 20 children between them.  They are originally from Sauce, which is in the north of the country.  The mothers are hard-working, responsible and all have a great desire to get ahead.  They like to spend their spare time with their children.  Unfortunately, they were not able to study due to a lack of money and were obliged to work from a young age.  These women fight every day in order to provide their children with a better future.

Normalina is the coördinator of the communal bank and makes a living buying and selling swine.  Her objective for this loan is to buy live pigs, which are selling for a good price.  In the not-too-distant future she will be able to earn more money.  Normalina works some ten hours a day, selling her products.  The "La Esperanza" communal bank thanks Kiva lenders for their help supporting small businesses, whose owners have very little money.  The communal bank is also grateful that Kiva lenders are helping poor countries, such as Nicaragua, to give people a decent living.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock up her business buying and selling pigs.

loans.name: Ntube

texts.en:
Ntube is single with four children and they all live in a three bedroom apartment in Bamenda Mezam Division of the North West Region of Cameroon.  She has faced so many challenges, among which are inadequate finances to carry out her business and cater for her family needs, death of family members and other family issues, such as marital problems.

With the new loan requested, she will buy a sales kennel and she will rear animals in her compound.  She holds a positive view of this business being successful because she has regular customers who will buy her kneel and cattle.  She has a good business site and the demand of kennel is high in her area of resident.  With this business activity, the community will benefit from the kneel waste which will be used for feeding of pigs, she will sell to them at reduced prices, and she will ensure regular supply to her customers.

With the profit from this loan, she will cater for her family needs, ensure her children are educated.  She prefers GHAPE loan because of low interest rates, convenient repayment intervals and also the members are trained on marketing and management skills before the loans are given.

loans.use: To buy kennel and cattle

loans.name: Silas

texts.en:
Silas is a 35 year old married man.  He has 4 children ranging in age from 6 years to 14 years.  He describes himself to be ambitious. 

He operates a trade business where he sells 2nd hand clothes.  He has been involved in this business for 7 years.  His business is located in a market area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital for expansion.  He will use the KES 40,000 loan to purchase bails of clothes.  He hopes to have a boutique store in the future.  This is his 2nd application for a loan with SMEP DTM.  The previous being a loan for KES 20,000 that he repaid successfully.

loans.use: to purchase bails of clothes.

loans.name: Maulidi

texts.en:
Maulid has operated a fish selling business for over fifteen years, selling from her home to restaurant operators and passersby.  She faces a major challenge of seasonality and perishability leading to losses.

With the KES 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase bundles of fish and cooking fat for frying fish for sale.  She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish and cooking fat for frying fish for sale.

loans.name: Reyhan

texts.en:
Reyhan is 57 years old, married and the mother of one daughter.  Her husband is a driver.  Reyhan  is a merchant, who has dedicated her life to this business for the past 10 years. 

Reyhan is selling shampoo, washing powder, toothpaste, soaps, calgon, etc. in her store.  This not her own store, she is renting it.  The rental cost is high and she faces a lot of financial difficulties because of this.  These other problems are a lack of stock in the store and also family financial requirements.  She is hoping to have her own store in the future.   Now Reyhan requires 1,800 AZN loan in order to bring more products to her shop.  This her second loan.

loans.use: to buy more products for her shop

loans.name: Jenneh

texts.en:
Jenneh lives in New Kru town.  She is 22 years old, she is single with three children between the ages of  4 to 10 years old.  They are all in school and live at home.  Jenneh was not fortunate enough to attend school, but she has been keeping herself busy with business over the past twelve years selling charcoal in New-Kru-Town market. 

She started this business with a little money from her mother.  She said that fewer goods on her table are the only challenge she face now.  She likes her business because it is affordable, and she learned this way of selling from her friends.  She mentioned that she is proud of her business because it is the only means for me and my family to survive.  Jenneh said, with the loan she is going to buy more charcoal bags to resell since she has more customers.  Her plan is to increase her sales even more.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal bags to resell since i have more customers.

loans.name: Victor Daniel

texts.es:
Victor tiene 52 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Ica y trabaja en su pequeño negocio de gasfitero, oficio que aprendió desde muy joven y que gracias a ello puede solventar los gastos de su hogar con mucho esfuerzo; Victor puede atender hasta 2 clientes diariamente, ya que depende del tipo de trabajo que realice; él cree que está saliendo adelante porque es muy amable y realiza su trabajo con muchos esmero y sobre todo con responsabilidad.

Victor está muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá colocar ventanas en su vivienda ya que actualmente solo son cubiertas de cartones, de esta manera podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, lo que le permitirá seguir luchando cada día para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener una empresa y poder apoyar a su familia”.
texts.en:
Victor is 52 years old and lives in the city of Ica.  He has a small business where he works as a plumber - a trade that he learned at a young age and that has allowed him, with much effort, to cover household costs.  Victor can tend up to up two customers every day, depending on the kind of work he is doing.  Victor believes that he is getting ahead because he is friendly and works with great care and, particularly, responsibility.

Victor is very grateful to Kiva lenders as, thanks to the help provided, he will be able to install windows in his home.  Currently the spaces for the windows are covered by cardboard.  These windows will improve the family's quality of life and will allow Victor to continue fighting every day to accomplish his biggest dream - to have a business and be able to support his family.

loans.use: to put windows in his home.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is operating a food selling business.  She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation in her business. 

With the loan of KES 20,000, she is requesting that she wants to purchase stocks of wheat flour, rice, potatoes, and cooking oil for her business.  She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of  wheat flour, rice, potatoes, and cooking oil for her business

loans.name: Quimberly

texts.es: Quimberly es una joven de 20 años, aún no tiene hijos y actualmente vive en unión libre con su pareja. Se dedica a la venta de comidas especiales a domicilio, labor que realiza en compañía de su pareja los fines de semana. Es una mujer emprendedora, enérgica y luchadora, siempre esforzándose por obtener ingresos para apoyar el sostenimiento de las necesidades en su hogar. Con el crédito que solicita en la Corporación desea comprar insumos (verduras, carne, condimentos, productos lácteos, entre otros) para elaborar las comidas y adicionalmente desea ajustar el dinero para comprar una moto para hacer los domicilios de una forma más ágil, cumpliendo con la entrega a tiempo de los pedidos y, de esta manera aumentar las ventas y por ende las utilidades. Su principal sueño es montar un restaurante exclusivo que le permita generar mayores ingresos para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Quimberley is 20 years old.  She does not have any children yet and is currently living with her partner.  Quimberley makes a living selling special foods that she home delivers.  At the weekend she works with her husband.  Quimberley is enterprising, energetic and feisty.  She is always putting in the effort to earn an income to support the household.  She is applying for this loan because she wishes to buy supplies (such as vegetables, meat, condiments, dairy products) to prepare the foods and to pay the deposit on a motorcycle that she will use to make home deliveries more easily and on time.  With this she will be able to increase her sales and, thus, her profits.  Quimberley's biggest dream is to start her own restaurant that would allow her to earn a higher income and improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies (such as vegetables, meat, condiments, dairy products) and to pay the deposit on a motorcycle that she will use for home deliveries.

loans.name: Verdun 1 Group

texts.en:
Verdun 1 group is composed of three Filipino women, who came to Lebanon from the Philippines to work as housekeepers for covering their families needs.
Lenida is the featured borrower of the group.  She got along with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua because they have always been friends since they arrived in Lebanon.  

She is a 48-year-old widow, the mother of four children whom she sacrifices her whole life for their living and provides them with the necessary life needs.  Lenida applied for loan which will be sent to her kids who live with her family in the Philippines for their school needs.  She is the one standing in the middle.  Elena is the one wearing white, Minerva is wearing blue.

loans.use: to pay for her children's school fees

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
This is Natividad, 60, a resident of Tondo, Manila, Philippines. She is married to Romulo, a salesman, and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Natividad operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Natividad dreams that her business will continue to grow and hopes that she will have a good relationship with her family.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and there she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
Bahati, aged 32 years, is married and a mother of five children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a family house that has electricity but not piped water. Her highest monthly expenses are school fees and transport. 

For the past year, she has operated a business selling cosmetics from her shop to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high transportation costs in her business. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing a boutique shop in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 20,000, she wants to purchase cosmetics for her shop. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics for her shop.

loans.name: Seinna

texts.en:
Seinna lives and works in St. Paul.   St. Paul is home to the oldest market in Liberia and is known for their fish due to its location by the sea.  St. Paul is a suburb located just outside Monrovia, past Freeport.  It is one of the poorer areas and you will often find its residents living in sub-standard housing. 

She is 33 years old and is married and her husband is a driver.  They both have five children between the age 3 and 15 years old, which live at home and in school.  Seinna did not attend school, but she said, she is good at managing her business.  Sienna runs a table business selling pepper, oil, rice, vita, salt, etc.  

She describes herself as serious business woman.  She started her business 15 years ago, using money given to her by her husband.  Typically, she works 7Am to 5Pm from Monday to Saturday at her business and transports her goods to her business by bus.  She cites her greatest challenge as small capital.  

She is proud of her business because it supports her home.  Using the proceeds of this loan, she intends to purchase more pepper, oil, rice, vita, salt, etc for her business.  In the future, she plans to build her house and educate her children.   She sincerely thanks you in advanced for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more pepper, oil, rice, vita, salt, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Tubandanye Ii Group

texts.fr:
Simon fait partie du groupe Tubandanye et habite à  Gitega. Il  a 61 ans et est marié à  Godelieve, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont  1 enfant de 19 ans, il est commerçant.
  
Il fait le commerce de petits pois, poivrons, et poireaux  depuis 15  ans. 

Il est à son deuxième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de petit pois, poivrons et poireaux  à revendre pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Simon is a member of Tubandanye Group who lives in Gitega. He's 61 years old and married to Godelieve, a cultivator. Together, they have one 19-year-old child who is a merchant.

Simon has been buying and selling peas, bell peppers and leeks for fifteen years. He's seeking his second loan from Kiva's partner, Turame. He will use it to bolster his working capital and buy a large amount of peas, bell peppers, and leeks to resell, in order to increase his income.

loans.use: to buy peas, bell peppers, and leeks

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Afin de renforcer son stock de céréales et prendre soin de sa famille (mariée et mère de famille), Afi fait une première demande de crédit à WAGES pour pouvoir répondre à ses besoins. Avec une ancienneté d’01an dans l’activité, elle s’approvisionne à Lomé et dans les villes reculées du pays et s’y plait bien car cela lui procure des revenus considérables. Âgée de 29ans, son souhait est de rendre pérenne son activité et assurer au mieux aux besoins de la famille.
texts.en: Afi, age 29, is married with children. She is seeking a first loan from WAGES to strengthen her stock of cereals to sell and to provide for her family. She has one year of experience in this activity. She buys her stock in Lomé and in remote cities of the country, and she enjoys her work as it provides her with substantial income. Her goals are to make her activity sustainable and to provide for her family’s needs as best as possible.

loans.use: to buy cereals to sell.

loans.name: Himbarwa Group

texts.fr:
J.Désiré  fait partie du groupe  Himbarwa et habite à  Gitega. Il  a 42 ans et est marié à  Pascasie, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 6 enfants,  âgés de  4  à 19 ans, dont 2 étudient.  

Il fait le commerce de madriers  depuis 16  ans. 

Il est à son deuxième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de madriers à revendre pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
J.Désiré is a member of Himbarwa Group and lives in Gitega. He's 42 years old and married to Pascasie, a cultivator. Together, they have six children, aged 4 to 19. Out of them, two attend school

J.Désiré has been selling timber fro 16 years. He's seeking his second loan from Kiva's partner, Turame. He will use it to bolster his working capital and buy a large amount of timber to resell, in order to increase his income.

loans.use: to buy timber

loans.name: Améyo

texts.fr: Afin de renforcer son stock de produits d’alimentation générale et prendre soin de sa famille (veuve et mère de 02 enfants tous scolarisés, âgés de 25 et 22ans), Améyo fait une demande de crédit à WAGES pour pouvoir répondre à ses besoins. Avec une ancienneté de 10ans dans l’activité, elle s’approvisionne au Grand marché de Lomé et s’y plait bien car cela lui procure des revenus considérables. Âgée de 52ans, son souhait est d’avoir une boutique et assurer l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en: Améyo, age 52, is the widowed mother of two children aged 22 and 25 who both attend school. She is seeking a loan from WAGES to strengthen her stock of general food products to sell, and to take care of her family. She has 10 years of experience in this activity. She buys her stock at the Grand market of Lomé, and she enjoys her work as it provides her with substantial income. Her goals are to open a store and to support her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy general food products and various items to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her communication credit for her call center.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es:
Magdalena Beatriz se dedica a la venta de medicamentos en su farmacia, ubicado en la zona  16 de febrero en  el El Alto, magdalena es madre soltera vive en la casa de sus padres en la zona mercado carmen en la cuidad de El Alto.

El crédito es para ampliación de su farmacia y de esta manera mejorar sus ingresos económicos.

El sueño de Magdalena Beatriz, es tener un laboratorio de farmacia

Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Magdalena Beatriz earns a living selling medicine at her pharmacy, located in El Alto's district known as "16 de Febrero." She is a single mother and lives in her parents' house in the "Mercado Carmen" district of El Alto.  

The loan is to expand her pharmacy in order to improve her income. 

Magdalena Beatriz's dream is to have a pharmaceutical laboratory. This is her first time requesting a loan from IMPRO and KIVA.

loans.use: to expand her pharmacy.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en: Analyn is 43 years old, married, and has three children. Analyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and applied for a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items, including rice, sugar, soap, eggs and noodles, to sell. Analyn has borrowed and repaid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from buying and selling coconut timber. Analyn aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items, includuing rice, sugar, soap, eggs and noodles, to sell at her store.

loans.name: Habiba

texts.en: Habiba is a married mother with children, all of whom attend school. They live at their own house that has electricity but not piped water. She operates a food stall, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition from other food-stall operators. With KES 20,000, she wants to buy cooking oil, maize flour, wheat flour and rice for resale. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income in the future.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil, maize flour, wheat flour and rice for resale.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther lives in New Kru town. She is 35 years old, married, and has seven children between 5 and 15, who are in school and live at home.  For the past ten years, she has been operating a table business where she sells charcoal and rice in the local market. She says sometimes buying goes slowly. Esther says she started this business by selling around in the communities with the small quantity of goods she could afford. She learned this way of selling from her friends. She is applying for a loan to buy more goods (charcoal and rice) for her business. Her plan is to increase her business even more. She thanks the supporters of BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more goods (charcoal and rice) to sell in her business.

loans.name: Ngum

texts.en: Ngum is married and has one child.  They both live in a three-bedroom apartment in the Bamenda North West Region of Cameroon. She has faced recurring challenges in life, among which is inadequate finance to start up a business and cover her family needs. Marital problems also have been a main difficulty for her. With this loan, she plans to invest in buying vegetables of all types, such as hackberries, cabbages, and all types of green spices. Also, part of the loan will be invested in buying and selling potatoes. She believes this business will succeed, because she has been doing this for a long time, and she believes that there is high demand for foodstuffs in the region, due to increases in population, which will provide a market for the items she sells. The community will benefit from this business activity because, with the profit from this loan, she will cover her family’s needs, ensure her child’s education, and renovate her house. She prefers GHAPE loans because of the social talks given during GHAPE meetings and the convenient repayment schedule for the loan. Also, the members are trained in marketing and management skills before the loans are disbursed.

loans.use: to buy and sell vegetables, potatoes and other food items.

loans.name: Irma Yolanda

texts.es: Doña Irma de 60 años vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo de 18 años de edad, ella se dedica  a la venta de pupusas y panes con pollo, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia tiene 18 años de tener su negocio que le ha generado buenas ganancias, doña Irma esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar todos los ingredientes necesarios para la preparación de sus alimentos como: maíz, frijoles, chicharrón,  quesillo, panes, pollos, tomates, pepinos, etc. para poder seguir  con su negocio y así poder darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Irma, 60 years old, lives in her own house with her husband and her son who is 18 years old.  She makes a living selling "pupusas" (a traditional dish in El Salvador consisting of a thick, handmade tortilla filled with cheese, beans or meat) and bread with chicken.  She has her business located in her place of residence.  She has had her business for 18 years and it has generated good earnings for her.  

Irma is requesting a loan to be able to buy all of the necessary ingredients for the preparation of her foods like corn, beans, pork, fresh cheese, bread, chicken, tomatoes, cucumber, etc. to be able to continue with her business and in this way be able to give her family better financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase corn, beans, pork, fresh cheese, bread, chicken, tomatoes, cucumbers, etc.

loans.name: Erenia Del Socorro

texts.es: La  Erenia es una mujer visionaria y emprendedora, comerciante con 7 años de ejercer este tipo de trabajo es acompañada, actualmente está presentando una necesidad de mejorar s  su vivienda, por lo que se decidió visitar a ceprodel para solicitar un financiamiento para la compra de materiales de construcción como; Compra de bloque, arena,  hierro, cemento, zinc,  perlin, cerámica , bondex  y mano de obra, para realizar dichas obras la que tanto necesita y de esa manera mejorar las condiciones y nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Erenia is a visionary and an enterprising woman.  She is a businesswoman with seven years of experience, and she is in a relationship.  

Presently, she needs to improve her home.  This is why she decided to visit Ceprodel; she is requesting financing in order to purchase construction materials like: blocks, sand, iron bars, cement, corrugated tin roofing, purlins, ceramic tiles, mortar, and to pay for labor.  She needs these items in order to realize this necessary project and to thereby improve conditions and standard of living.

loans.use: to buy blocks, sand, iron bars, cement, corrugated tin roofing, purlins, ceramic tiles, mortar, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Arcely

texts.en: As a widowed parent of three children, Arcely works hard to support her family. She has a general store in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from renting rooms in a boarding house. Arcely is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy items to sell in her store, such as bottles of mineral water, cola drinks, bread, eggs, yoghurt and other groceries. Arcely has been maintaining her business activities with her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: buy additional  items to sell at her store, including bottles of mineral water, cola drinks, bread, eggs, yoghurt and other groceries.

loans.name: Magdaline

texts.en: Magdaline is a 26-year-old single woman. She has one child. She describes herself as persevering. She operates a beauty salon, where she weaves hair. She has been involved in this business for a year. Her business is located in a shopping center. She describes her biggest business challenge as inadequate capital for expansion. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy hair-weaving materials as stock. This is her first loan application.

loans.use: to buy a supply of hair-weaving materials for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Camra

texts.en: Camra is married and has six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Camra is 48 years old. Four of her children are in school. Camra has a business buying and selling spices in the Philippines. Camra applied for a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of spices to sell. Camra has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Camra would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of spices to sell.

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en: Hadija's business is selling makuti (palm frond thatching), operating in the market, where neighbors and passersby are potential customers. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. With the KES 50,000 loan, she wants to buy more makuti to sell at the market. She appreciates the support given to her.

loans.use: to purchase more makuti (palm frond thatching) for sale at the market

loans.name: Sopio

texts.en: Sopio is 38 years old. She lives in a suburb of Tbilisi (the capital city) with her father, brother and sister-in-law. Sopio’s father works as service staff at the local kindergarten, her brother is an operator at the petrol station, and her sister-in-law works as a consultant at the supermarket. All of them receive monthly salaries. Sopio’s economic activity is a small-scale trading business. She sells second-hand clothes and shoes locally. She applied for a loan from Credo to develop the trading business. Her loan application was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages providing of business start-up and re-startup credits on soft conditions to the rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, because they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low incomes. With the credit Sopio will buy brand-new clothing to sell with the used clothing. With the new business initiative, Sopio will be able to attract new customers and gradually increase the turnover in her trade business. Sopio awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy brand-new clothing and expand her trading business.

loans.name: Aleyda Del Pilar

texts.es: La Señora Aleyda, es  señora preocupada por la enseñanza y el aprendizaje de los demás, de profesión  Licenciada en Biología, se desempeña como maestra de educación secundaria en un instituto de la localidad con 30  años de laborar,  es casada con 1  hijo al que le está brindando el apoyo necesario para su desarrollo, actualmente tiene la necesidad de mejorar el techo y paredes de su vivienda , por tal razón se acerco a ceprodel para solicitar un financiamiento y lograr el objetivo  planteado, ya que lo utilizaría en la compra de Bloques, cemento, Perlin, Hierro, Arena, soldadura y Mano de Obra. Ya que dicha obra le ayudaría a mejorar sus condiciones y nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Aleyda is a woman who is concerned about the teaching and learning of others.  She has a degree in Biology, and has worked as a high school teacher at an institute in her neighborhood for thirty years.  She is married and has one son; she provides him with the necessary support for his development.

Presently, she needs to improve the roof and walls of her home.  For this reason, she has come to Ceprodel.  She is requesting financing in order to realize this proposed project.  She will use the loan to pay for blocks, cement, purlins, iron bars, sand, solder, and labor.  This work would help her to improve conditions and their standard of living.

loans.use: to pay for blocks, cement, purlins, iron bars, sand, solder, and labor so that she can repair the roof and wall.

loans.name: Chona

texts.en: Chona is 28 years old, married, and has one child, who is in school. Chona is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Chona applied for a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs. Chona has been raising pigs for two years, and she has borrowed 23 times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business. In the future, Chona would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a married woman with five school-going children. They live at their own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past four years, she has operated a tailoring business, working from the market where neighbours and passersby are potential customers. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation.

With the KES 50,000, she wants to purchase cloth and needles and repair her broken sewing machine.

loans.use: to purchase cloth and needles and repair her broken sewing machine.

loans.name: Juraita

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Juraita works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal. Juraita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF.

Juraita is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to purchase materials for the sidecar for her motorcycle transport business.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase materials for the sidecar.

loans.name: Siatt

texts.en:
Siatt lives and works in St. Paul. St. Paul is home to the oldest market in Liberia and is known for fish because of its location by the sea. St. Paul is a suburb located just outside Monrovia, past the free port. It is one of the poorer areas and you will often find its residents living in sub-standard housing.
 
She is 20 years old, married and her husband is a carpenter. They have two children, ages 5 and 1 year old, and one is in school. They all live at home. 

For the past three years, she has been operating a small table market where she sells body cream, hair grease, bath soap, etc. She started this business by selling for friends, and learned this way of selling from them.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more body cream, hair grease, bath soap, etc., for her business. Her plan is to increase her business even more.

loans.use: to purchase more body cream, hair grease, bath soap, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Safiatou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est composé de femmes très déterminées dans leurs activités génératrices de revenu. Ces dernières ayant un long vécu dans le programme des bancs villageois ont su développer un esprit de solidarité leur permettant de nos jours de faire face à beaucoup de situations. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Safiatou (assise à  droite avec la main gauche levée) est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est  âgée de 50 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants dont 03 garçons et 1 fille. Elle s’active dans la vente de patte d’arachide et d’huile de palme qu’elle achète au marché international de la sous région, par bidon de 20 litres pour l’huile de palme, de même que pour la patte d’arachide. La revente se fait au détail par litre à 1 100 F Cfa pour l’huile de palme et 750 F Cfa le kg de patte d’arachide.

Avec ce prêt elle compte acheter 2 à 3 bidons d’huile de palme et 1 à 2 seaux de patte d’arachide.

Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettront de mieux assister ses enfants dans leur scolarité.
texts.en:
This group is made up of women who are very determined in their money-earning businesses. They've been part of the Banc Villageois program for a long time, and managed to develop a spirit of solidarity, which nowadays enables them to cope with many situations. Their main business is retail.

Mrs. Safiatou (sitting on the right and raising her hand in the photograph) is the group's featured borrower. She's 50 years old, married, and the mother of three boys and one girl. Her business consists in selling peanut pasta and palm oil, that she buys in 20-liter cans at the international market of her subregion.

She resells by the liter for XOF 1'100 (ca US$ 2.2) for the palm oil, and XOF 750 (ca US$ 1.5) for the peanut pasta. With this loan, she intends to buy 2 to 3 cans of palm oil, and 1 or 2 buckets of peanut pasta.

The profits generated by her business will enable her to better support her children in their studies.

loans.use: to buy palm oil and peanut pasta

loans.name: Yawo

texts.fr: Yawo est un homme âgé de 49 ans. Il est marié å une revendeuse. Il a 5 enfants, dont 3 à l’école. Le premier a 12 ans et le dernier a 02mois. Yawo travaille comme jardinier revendeur depuis 2001. Il vend des engrais pour tous clients dans son jardin. Il achète les produits à Lomé. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est la rupture de stock. Yawo a requis son second crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des engrais, des graines à semer. Il veut réinvestir dans l’activité. Dans les prochaines années, Yawo voudrait agrandir son commerce et la taille de son jardin. Il dit qu’avec les profits, il prévoit de prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en:
Yawo is 49 years old and married to a retailer. He has five children, of whom three attend school. The oldest is 12 and the youngest two months old. 

Yawo has been working as a gardener and retailer since 2001. He sells fertilizer to all comers at his garden. He buys his goods in  Lomé. At the moment his principal difficulty is running out of stock. 

Yawo has requested his second loan from WAGES in order to buy fertilizer and seeds to sow. He wants to reinvest in his business. In the coming years, Yawo would like to grow his business and also the size of his garden. He says that with the profit, he intends to take care of his family.

loans.use: to buy garden products, fertilizers, etc.

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
Nicholas has been mixed farming in Nyahururu for the past four years.  

He used his previous loan to buy a cow, and he paid the loan back on time. He has applied for his second loan from Kadet Ltd to buy a cow and to cultivate the land. He will use the anticipated profit to expand his farming.

In the future, Nicholas hopes to grow his business and make more income, thereby improving the living standards of his family.

loans.use: To buy a cow and cultivate the land.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

Marilou has been in this business for two years. She earns additional income from farming rice.

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase stocks like soap, shampoo, milk, can goods, chips, etc., for her general store business.

Marilou has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase stocks like soap, shampoo, milk, can goods, chips, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Rosa Lina

texts.es:
Rosa, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo porque necesita más capital de trabajo para invertir en la crianza de animales de corral; este le permitirá comprar cerdos para engordarlos y luego venderlos.
El efecto del crédito anterior fue favorable, ya que le ayudo a crecer y obtener mejores ingresos; las circunstancias familiares y las condiciones económicas han mejorado.
texts.en:
Rosa is in need of another loan because she needs more working capital to invest in raising farm animals.  A loan will allow her to buy pigs in order to fatten and later sell them.

The effect of the previous loan was favorable; it helped her to grow and obtain a higher income.  Her familial circumstances and their economic situation have improved.

loans.use: to buy pigs in order to fatten and later sell them.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a DVD burner for her business selling movies and music videos.

loans.name: Zaira

texts.en:
Zaira is 40 years old. She lives in the small village of Khelvachauri District with her husband, two children, and mother-in-law, who is provided with a retirement pension. 

Several times, Zaira requested a loan from local financial institutions for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected each time because of low income and her family’s poor living conditions. 

The primary source of income for the family is from agricultural activities. In particular, they have a milking cow, whose milk is used in cheese products. In addition, they have a hectare of agricultural land where different kinds of vegetables are grown. They sell the produced cheese and vegetables at local markets. It is hardly enough money for food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the 'subsistence poor' category. 

Zaira requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Zaira has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits, with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as 'high-risk borrowers' because of their low income. 

With the received credit, Zaira will open a grocery shop. As the grocery shop is opened, she will be able to increase the income of her family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to open a grocery shop.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is married and has four children and three of her children go to school.  She also takes care of three brothers. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to neither electricity nor piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent. 

She has a business of selling ground nuts and has been in this business for four years. She generates additional income through selling Irish potato chips. She works at the market. She sells on a retail basis and works seven days out of every week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation.  

She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of ground nuts.

She is aspiring to become a wholesaler and also to build her own house.

loans.use: To buy more bags of ground nuts.

loans.name: Ouleye's Group

texts.fr:
C e groupe est composé de femmes très déterminées dans leurs activités génératrices de revenu. Ces dernières ayant un long vécu dans le programme des bancs villageois ont su développer un esprit de solidarité leur permettant de nos jours de faire face à beaucoup de situations. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Oulèye (assise à l’extrême droite) est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est  âgée de 47 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants dont 01 garçon et 03 filles. Son consiste à l’achat de tissus qu’elle confectionne en boubou ou autres articles à savoir nappe et drap pour la revente soit au comptant ou à crédit par deux tranches.

Avec ce prêt elle compte acheter une dizaine de mètres de tissus unique et des fils décoratifs en vu de confectionner des nappes pour la revente. 

Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettront de participer à la dépense quotidienne et de prendre en charge une partie de la scolarité de ses enfants pour la rentrée prochaine.
texts.en:
This group consists of women who show great determination in their income-generating activities. With extensive experience with the Banc Villageois programs, they have developed a spirit of solidarity that helps them to face many situations. Their main activity is small trade.

Mrs. Oulèye (sitting at the far right) is the featured borrower for this group. She is a 47-year-old married mother of four children, a boy and three girls. She buys fabrics that she uses to make boubous (large full-length dress) or other items such as tablecloths and bed sheets. She sells these items for cash or on credit in two installments.

She will use this loan to buy about ten meters of unique fabrics and some decorative thread to make tablecloths to sell.

The profits earned will allow her to help with her family’s daily expenses and to support part of her children’s tuition when school resumes in the near future.

loans.use: to buy about ten meters of unique fabrics and some decorative thread to make tablecloths to sell.

loans.name: Adja Matel's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est composé de femmes très déterminées dans leurs activités génératrices de revenu. Ces dernières ayant un long vécu dans le programme des bancs villageois ont su développer un esprit de solidarité leur permettant de nos jours de faire face à beaucoup de situations. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Matel (assise  à droite), est l’emprunteuse vedette de ce groupe. Elle est  âgée de 48 ans,  elle est célibataire sans enfant. Cependant elle est femme très rigoureuse dans son commerce. Elle mène diverses activités en passant de la pâtisserie (sur commande lors des cérémonies familiales et religieuses), à la vente de miel et de jus de citron à  des clients basés dans les régions du nord et du centre.

Avec ce prêt elle compte renforcer son commerce par l’achat en quantité :  
-Pour le miel 10  bidons  de 10 litres à 90 000 F CFA les 10 bidons.
-Pour le citron 05 bidons de 20 litres à 40 000 F CFA les 05 bidons
-Pour la farine 02 sacs en vu de faire face à toute commande.

Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettront de mieux assoir son commerce et d’apporter son aide à son père et ses frères et sœurs, mais surtout d’avoir une autonomie financière.
texts.en:
This group is made up of women who are very determined in their money-earning businesses. They've been part of the Banc Villageois program for a long time, and managed to develop a spirit of solidarity, which nowadays enables them to cope with many situations. Their main business is retail.

Mrs. Matel (sitting on the right in the photograph) is the group's featured borrower. She's 48 years old, unmarried and without children. She's very rigorous in her business. She runs various businesses, such as selling pastry (on order for familial or religious celebrations), or selling honey and lemon juice to her clients in the northern and central regions.

With this loan, she intends to strengthen her business by buying large quantities of supplies: ten 10-liter cans of honey (for XOF 90'000, ca US$ 180), five 20-liter cans of lemon juice (for XOF 40'000, ca US$ 80), and two sacks of flour in order to be ready to handle any order. 

The profits generated by her business will enable her to consolidate her business and help her father and siblings, and, most importantly, to be self-supporting.

loans.use: to buy honey, lemon juice, and flour

loans.name: Mwalimu

texts.en:
Mwalimu is 28 years of age and he is married. He is also a father of four. Two of his children attend school and their ages are 7 and 5. Mwalimu lives in Malindi, Kenya.

He is a carpenter by training and that is what he does for a living. He operates a carpentry shop. He also does poultry farming at his farm.

He knew Milango though a Milango employee. He seeks a loan to buy carpentry tools and more chicks. He wants to open more workshops in his place, called Ganda, so that he can tap into the growing number of of people who need his services. The challenge he faces include competition and high cost of timber and wood.

loans.use: to buy carpentry tools and more chicks.

loans.name: Francia

texts.en:
Francia is 54 years old and married with four children.

Francia works hard to provide for her family. She sells school supplies in the Philippines. She has been running the business for two years and also earns an income from food vending and raising pigs. 

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional school supplies like cartolina (construction paper), paper, notebooks, erasers, pencils, etc., to sell.

Francia has borrowed and repaid 21 loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Francia aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional school supplies like cartolina, paper, notebooks, erasers, pencils, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for six years and she earns additional income from buying and selling bananas.

She is borrowing PHP 26,000 through NWTF to purchase items to sell like canned goods, milk, soap, shampoo, etc., for her general store business.

Gina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like canned goods, milk, soap, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Adelfa

texts.en:
Adelfa is 45 years old and widowed, with one child in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Adelfa runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy items to sell, like shampoo, canned goods, chips, soap, and other groceries.

Adelfa has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Adelfa would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like shampoo, canned goods, chips, soap, and other groceries.

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en:
Rachael is a widowed woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past six years, she has operated a food kiosk business, selling food like maize flour and cooking fat to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned seasonality as her major challenge and she dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, sugar, and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, sugar, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Selina

texts.en:
Selina is 35 years old and married, with three children who are in school. 

She is in a shoe-selling business which she has operated for the past three and half years. She earns an average income of KES 40,000 per month. She hopes to buy more stocks of shoes with the anticipated loan.

Selina hopes to expand her business to a wholesale business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy shoes to sell.

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en:
Rachael has a stationery business and also supplies eggs in Nakuru. She has applied for her second loan from Kadet Ltd. to enable her to buy eggs for resale. She repaid her previous loan on time. With her anticipated profit, she hopes to pay school fees and pay back the loan.

She hopes to buy a pickup in the near future.

loans.use: To buy eggs for sale.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana works hard to support her family. She is married. and has a tailoring business business in the Philippines.

Susana requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional linen, tailoring chalk, etc to be used in her business.

Susana has been in this business for 22 years.

In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional linen, tailoring chalk, etc to be used in her business

loans.name: Donald

texts.en:
Donald is 38 years old and married with one child.

Donald works hard to provide for his family. He runs a buy and sell firewood business in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy an additional stock of firewood to sell.

Donald has borrowed and paid eleven loans from NWTF prior to this loan. He has been running the buy and sell firewood for ten years, and also earns income from raising livestock, a buy and sell charcoal business, and motorcycle transport.

Donald aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for his family.

loans.use: to buy an additional stock of firewood to sell

loans.name: Ansatou Djite's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est composé de  femmes très actives dans ce banc villageois créé en Décembre 2010. Il regroupe en son sein des femmes  qui sont toutes issues du même quartier et ont une bonne entente et solidarité les membres. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Ansatou (assise droite), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe,  âgée de 35 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 03  enfants (1 Garçon et 2 filles). C’est une femme qui connait une évolution notable depuis son entrée dans le système des bancs villageois et sa capacité a financé son activité suit une croissance notable. En plus de son activité directe au marché, elle achète du poisson sec dans la côtière du sud du pays par panier.

Avec ce prêt elle compte s’approvisionner en poisson sec, en huile de palme et  patte d’arachide.
- Pour poisson sec 04 paniers à 60 000 F Cfa, qu’elle revend au détail au prix variant entre 200 et 1 000 F Cfa.
- Pour l’huile de palme 02 bidons de 20 litres à 30 000 F Cfa revendus par bouteille d’un litre à 1 000 F Cfa et sachet de 100 à 200 F Cfa.
- Pour la patte d’arachide 02 seaux de 20 litres à 26 000 F Cfa revendus par détail en sachet de 100 à 500 F Cfa. 

Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettront de soutenir son mari dans la gestion quotidienne de la maison et de renforcer son épargne.
texts.en:
This group is made up of women who are very active in the village bank that was created in December 2010. The women who are at the heart of the group all come from the same neighbourhood and they get on well with each other and share a good solidarity. Their main activity is small business.
Mrs. Ansatou (sitting on the right) is the star borrower of the group. She is 35 and is married with three children (one boy and two girls.) This woman has made noteworthy progress since she joined the village bank system and her capacity to finance her business has progressed well. In addition to her activity at the market, she buys dried fish in the coastal area to the south of the country by the basketful.
With this loan she plans to stock up on dried fish, palm oil, and groundnut paste.
For four baskets of dried fish at 60 000 F Cfa, that she resells retail at a price that varies between 200 and 1000 F Cfa
For 2 cans of 20 litres of palm oil at 30 000 F Cfa that she resells in sachets at 100 or 200 FCfa and bottles of one litre for 1'000 FCfa.
For two buckets of 20 litres of groundnut paste at 26 000 F Cfa resold for 100 to 500 F Cfa. per sachet.
The profits from her activity enable her to help her husband to assume the daily management of the household and to increase her savings.

loans.use: to stock up on dried fish, palm oil, and groundnut paste.

loans.name: Sherina

texts.en:
Sherina is married with two children, and only one of her children goes to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. 

She has a business of selling used clothes. She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bales of used   children’s clothes.  

She works from home seven days out of every week and sells on retail basis only. Her major business challenge include seasonality and thieves. She is aspiring of importing used clothes and also to buy her own house. The family resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used children's clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is a married woman with six children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

She sells food in her small cafe to the general public. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business and lack of enough capital for the continuity of the business.

With the 10,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase foodstuffs of maize flour, wheat flour, rice and sugar for her business. She decided to join Yehu get financial assistance to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase foodstuffs of maize flour, wheat flour, rice and sugar for her business.

loans.name: Jyldyzkan

texts.ru: Жылдызкан, 37 лет, замужем, многодетная мама, имеет 4 детей (2сына и 2 дочери). По специальности – медсестра, работает в родильном доме. В поиске дополнительного дохода для своей семьи Жылдызкан с 1999 года начала разводить скот и заниматься полеводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 15000 сом(KGS). Ежемесячная прибыль ее семьи составляет 8000 сом(KGS). Супруг-строитель,помогает по хозяйству. На сегодняшний день она смогла развить полеводческую деятельность, также есть свое хозяйство. В хозяйстве у нее имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 3 бычка и 20 овец, а также имеется 2,40 ГА поливной земли на которой она ежегодно выращивает фасоль. В целях дальнейшего развития своего  хозяйства и полеводства Жылдызкан обратилась в Микрофинансовый Банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 70 000 сом (KGS) на покупку 1 бычка и 9 овец. Доходы от кредита Жылдызкан планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества скота в своем хозяйстве и обучение детей.
texts.en: Jyldyzkan is 37 years old, married and has four children (two sons and two daughters).  She is a nurse by profession and works at the birth and delivery center.  In search of an additonal income for her family, Jyldyzkan started to breed livestock and got involved in farming in 1999, having started this business with a sum of 15,000 som (KGS).  The family's monthly profit is 8,000 som (KGS).  Her husband is a construction worker and helps with the household business.  To-date, Jyldyzkan was able to develop her farming business and have her own farm.  Her farm contains two dairy cows, three bulls and twenty sheep, and also has 2.40 hectares of irrigated land, where she annually grows beans.  In order to further grow her farming and animal husbandry business, Jyldyzkan requested a loan in the amount of 70,000 som (KGS) from the Microfinance Bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to buy one bull and nine sheep.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing livestock quantities on her farm and educating her children.

loans.use: to buy one bull and nine sheep

loans.name: Maria Belinda

texts.es: La Sra. Maria tiene 54 años y es casada con hijos ya independientes, ella se dedica  a la venta de   artículos de temporada a crédito, según lo que crea conveniente vender y a veces por pedido que ella visita distintos mercados de la zona ofreciendo sus productos,   Este préstamo es su segunda secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Maria va a usar este préstamo para la compra de Mercadería para surtir la variedad de sus productos, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es porque la cliente no cuenta con reservas de dinero para estas fechas. La Sra.
